result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darnell V Jones

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darnell V Jones in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. Motion for Appointment of Counsel and Financial Disclosure Statement, granted in court. $100 per month beginning December 1st. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Darnell V Jones
Current: 608 Sheridan Rd., Winthrop Harbor, IL 60096 United States  (Effective: 10-31-2022)
Prior: 2114 Muir Field Rd #1, Madison, WI 53719 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Darnell V Jones
Current: 2114 Muir Field Rd #1, Madison, WI 53719 United States  (Effective: 10-10-2022)
Prior: 608 Sheridan Rd., Apt 2, Winthrop Harbor, IL 60096
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH S.D.P. 10-14-1991 or RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Darnell V Jones in court.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Signature bond set. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
